messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor?
The ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor takes the keypoint output from the OpenPose estimator node and calculates bounding boxes around those keypoints.
What information does the ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor need to output a bounding box?
The ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor needs the width and height of the original image to output a bounding box within that image.
Where are the points located on the OpenPose skeleton in relation to the limbs?
The points on the OpenPose skeleton are located inside the particular limb, such as the center of the wrist or middle of the shoulder.
Why might you want to apply padding around the bounding box generated by the ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor?
You might want to apply padding around the bounding box to get the whole arm, leg, or whatever you're looking for, as the points are located inside the limbs.
What should you provide in the Node to reference which control point is which?
To reference which control point is which, you should provide a comma-separated list in the Node, as per the OpenPose Docs.
Where can you find more information about the OpenPose output?
More information about the OpenPose output can be found in the OpenPose Docs on GitHub.
How can you use the ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor in your workflow?
To use the ComfyUI-OpenPose-Keypoint-Extractor in your workflow, you can drag the provided workflow image into your ComfyUI.
